data.title: Dodge Center, Minnesota Population History
data.meta_description: Access the most recent census population information for Dodge Center, Minnesota, including a population profile and history.
data.text:
What is the voting age population of Dodge Center, Minnesota?

The total voting age population of Dodge Center, Minnesota, meaning US citizens 18 or older, is 1,900. The voting age population is 51.3% male and 48.7% female.

What percentage of Dodge Center, Minnesota residents are senior citizens?

According to the latest census statistics, 15.9% of the residents of Dodge Center are 65 or older.

What are the racial demographics of Dodge Center, Minnesota?

The racial demographics of Dodge Center are 86.2% White, 11.6% Other, 1.2% Asian, 0.8% Two or more races and 0.2% American Indian. Additionally, 12.9% of the population identifies as Hispanic.

What percentage of Dodge Center, Minnesota residents are below the poverty line?

In Dodge Center, 10.1% of residents have an income below the poverty line, and the child poverty rate is 15.1%. On a per-household basis, 10.7% of families are below the poverty line in Dodge Center.

What percentage of Dodge Center, Minnesota residents are in the labor force?

Among those aged 16 and older, 70.6% of Dodge Center residents are in the labor force.

What are the education levels among Dodge Center, Minnesota residents?

Among the adult population 25 years old and over, 88.8% of Dodge Center residents have at least a high school degree or equivalent, 19.0% have a bachelor's degree and 4.6% have a graduate or professional degree.

What percentage of Dodge Center, Minnesota residents speak a non-English language at home?

Among Dodge Center residents aged 5 and older, 12.6% of them speak a non-English language at home. Broken down by language: 11.4% of residents speak Spanish at home, 0.6% speak an Indo-European language, and 0.6% speak an Asian language.

What is the unemployment rate in Dodge Center, Minnesota?

The unemployment rate in Dodge Center is 3.8%, which is calculated among residents aged 16 or older who are in the labor force.

What percentage of Dodge Center, Minnesota residents work for the government?

In Dodge Center, 12.9% of the residents in the non-military labor force are employed by the local, state and federal government.

What is the median income in Dodge Center, Minnesota?

The median household income in Dodge Center is $58,179.

What percentage of housing units are owner-occupied in Dodge Center, Minnesota?

In Dodge Center, 75.1% of housing units are occupied by their owners.

What percentage of housing units are rented in Dodge Center, Minnesota?

Renters occupy 24.9% of housing units in Dodge Center.

What percentage of Dodge Center, Minnesota housing units were built before 1940?

Of all the housing units in Dodge Center, 20.3% of them were build before 1940.

What percentage of Dodge Center, Minnesota housing units were built after 2000?

In Dodge Center, 19.2% of the total housing units were built after the year 2000, which is approximately 210 units.

What is the median monthly rent in Dodge Center, Minnesota?

The median gross monthly rent payment for renters in Dodge Center is $663.

What percentage of households in Dodge Center, Minnesota have broadband internet?

In Dodge Center, 82.7% of households have an active broadband internet connection.
